main event: A single bright light, elliptical in shape, was observed hovering at an estimated 2,000 feet over Denver, Colorado on July 6, 1969.
interesting points: The light pulsed and changed color from white to blue-green.
The object remained stationary for approximately 10 minutes, then accelerated rapidly in a northeasterly direction and disappeared from view.
The witness appeared to be a credible observer, and no evidence of a hoax or misidentification was found.
Several other witnesses in different areas around Denver also reported seeing the object, and their descriptions were consistent.
No physical evidence, such as photographs or radar data, was collected to help identify the object.
witnesses: a single witness, as well as several other witnesses in different areas around Denver
photographs: no, the report states that no photographs were taken
